IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Gould Academy prepares academically motivated students for college and helps them to become independent-minded, ethical citizens who will lead lives of purpose, action, excellence, and compassion in a dynamic world. The school serves approximately 235 boarding and day students.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Gould Academy prepares academically motivated students for college and helps them to become independent-minded, ethical citizens who will lead lives of purpose, action, excellence, and compassion in a dynamic world. The school serves approximately 235 boarding and day students.
IRS990.Description: Taught and educated one student at a time through strong student-faculty relationships that reflect a deep knowledge of each student as an individual and that foster sound work habits, a strong sense of self confidence, teamwork, and leadership skills, and principled decision-making.Ensured that every Gould student benefited from education of the whole person through rich and challenging, yet supportive, academic, co-curricular, and community life programs that promote development across all domains of personal growth.Helped students explore the whole world through academic engagement with major global themes, immersion in diverse cultures, meaningful experience in the natural world, and direct involvement in initiatives that promote ecosystem and energy sustainability.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The overall goal of the endowment funds is to balance the operating and non-operating funding needs of the Academy with the long-term preservation and growth of the Academy's assets.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Effective July 1, 2009, the Academy adopted the provisions of Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes as provided for in the Income Taxes topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification. This statement clarifies the criteria that an individual tax position must satisfy for some or all of the benefits of that position to be recognized in an entity's financial statements. It also prescribes a recognition threshold of more likely-than-not, and a measurement attribute for all tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return, in order for those tax positions to be recognized in the financial statements. There was no cumulative effect on the Academy's financial statements related to adoption of these provisions, and no interest or penalties related to uncertain tax positions were accrued. The Academy is currently open to audit under the statute of limitations by the Internal Revenue Service and state taxing authorities for the years ended June 30, 2007 through 2010.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Included on every enrollment agreement and in every Admission viewbook.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Students seeking financial aid access a Student School Services (SSS) application from the school's website. The completed application is then sent to SSS who processes and sends a hard copy to the school with an amount that SSS has determined that the family can pay toward boarding and day tuition. The Administration office at the school then uses this information to help make the financial aid determination.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Housing Residence - As a boarding secondary school, we mandate campus housing for certain employees.

OtherNonCashContributionsTable.Description: Gift Cert's for Various Items for Auction

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Audit committee reviews and then reports to the full trustee board, the full board does not review.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The School asks board members and senior staff to fill out a conflict of interest form annually and keeps them on file.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation Committee of Board reviews all senior staff and compares data.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The school makes these forms and returns available through the guidestar website and are available upon request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The school does not make these documents available to the public.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part XI, Line 2(C) - Responsibiliy for audit:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: No change in the schools procedures. Process handled by audit committee.
Form 990, Schedule E, Line 2 - Stmt of Racially Nondiscrimination Policy: The Academy includes the statement on most (but not all) brochures, catalogues and other written communications.
